Articles.Content: You might remember his tutorial videos from the earlier days of KSP. He would always greet with "Hello world!" and end with "I will see you out there!". What happened to this guy? I really hope he'd post some new vids.

His videos are how I originally learned to play KSP - I messaged him about 2 years ago asking if he planned to continue his series ... he said he was busy with school but I guess he lost interest in the game or just never freed up.

Man you guys are lucky. I had to learn KSP from trial and error. So much error. Waaayy too much error. (which I believe is the best way to learn) ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Man you guys are lucky. I had to learn KSP from trial and error. So much error. Waaayy too much error. (which I believe is the best way to learn) ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Thats how I did it too ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Thats how I did it too ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Same here, with some help from the wiki a bit later.

"Whose rocketship is this?"

"It's not a rocketship, baby. It's a command pod."

"Whose command pod is this?"

"It's Jeb's."

"Who's Jeb?"

"Jeb's dead, baby. Jeb's dead."
I learned from Scott Manley. Hard to go wrong with that xD
